snakey.name: Snakey
snakey.description: By swallowing each other’s tails, snakeys can chain together into a mega-snake.

chane.name: Chane
chane.description: Each orb in the link contains its own brain system.

corab.name: Corab
corab.description: Through natural evolution Corabs have become immune to boiling.

gimbalgram.name: Gimbalgram
gimbalgram.description: Its shadow is its real body.

droid.name: Droid
droid.description: Droid’s ball-based movement doesn’t work on some terrains including sand.

slime.name: Slime
slime.description: While traditionally considered an enemy mob by adventurers, this hasn’t prevented some from keeping Slimes as pets.

whawel.name: Whawel
whawel.description: Under its wings there is a large inventory for retrieving items.

electro.name: Electro
electro.description: Electro’s long ears act as pokes for generating static electricity.

flowey.name: Flowey
flowey.description: Don’t be fooled by their innocent appearance, Flowey are wicked creatures.

embloom.name: Embloom
embloom.description: This fire flower converts chlorophyll into intense heat as it travels through its long stem, culminating in fiery blasts from its central hole.

hylics.name: Hylics
hylics.description: They have a nearly human vocal system but everything they say sounds like gibberish.

spindew.name: Spindew
spindew.description: In the nooks and crannies of caves can be seen miniature fortresses of webbing.

monovamp.name: Monovamp
monovamp.description: This nocturnal predator is blind in its only one eye.

baba.name: Baba
baba.description: Despite its gentle appearance, Baba is highly aggressive, making it an uneasy presence in any situation.

blubo.name: Blubo
blubo.description: Using bubbles released in linguistic patterns, Blubo can communicate with each other under the water.

bunbun.name: Bunbun
bunbun.description: Known for dozing off during battles, Bunbun’s opponents sometimes leave it alone out of pity.

breamo.name: Breamo
breamo.description: Legends tell of a dragon in the family of Breamo but no such phenomena has ever been recorded.

tempoon.name: Tempoon
tempoon.description: Ablaze for its whole lifespan, Emball’s body achieves near perpetual energy.

bigator.name: Bigator
bigator.description: If it weren’t for the giant gator mouth you might think it were human.

ghost.name: Ghost
ghost.description: No one knows why some Pico Pals turn into ghosts when dying and others do not.

jaws.name: Jaws
jaws.description: Its heavy enlarged jaw drags along the floor when Jaws is too tired to keep up appearances.

raggit.name: Raggit
raggit.description: Though members of the rabbit family, you wont find Raggits hopping in the wild. They prefer to walk.

godot.name: Godot
godot.description: Its seemingly metallic exterior is actually a hard organic exoskeleton.

sunskin.name: Sunskin
sunskin.description: Sunskin spins clockwise when happy and counterclockwise when upset.

eacorn.name: Eacorn
eacorn.description: Eacorn burrows underground at the slightest noise, leaving only its cap above the surface.

antling.name: Antling
antling.description: Large antlers prevent Antling from rolling around and it has no legs to walk with.

gorbgob.name: Gorbgob
gorbgob.description: An alternative evolutionary line to our own ape ancestry.

ballbut.name: Ballbut
ballbut.description: The ball at the end of its tail doubles as a weapon and toy. It is heavy as metal.

been.name: Been
been.description: Unlike its more slimy cousins, Been’s body texture has been better compared to mochi.

shelbi.name: Shelbi
shelbi.description: Shelbi have more in common with dinosaurs than the bugs of today.

bell.name: Bell
bell.description: If not prevented by the mother, the father Bell will swallow their children whole.

bord.name: Bord
bord.description: What appears at first glance to be a nose is actually a tube-like mouth perfect for gathering nectar.

calfagrag.name: Calfagrag
calfagrag.description: It’s horns are full of beef.

papili.name: Papili
papili.description: Papili is not a bug but is in fact a bird.

sass.name: Sass
sass.description: Here kitty kitty! Here kitty kitty kitty!

caterwalk.name: Caterwalk
caterwalk.description: Caterwalk can swing its body in circles and achieve liftoff.

peep.name: Peep
peep.description: Despite being a domesticated Pico Pal, Peep’s eggs are not edible due to being charged with void energy.

clawbug.name: Clawbug
clawbug.description: Scientists have concocted machines for remote controlling Clawbugs and using them as weapons of war.

royabin.name: Royabin
royabin.description: High-class royalty have been known to balance Royabin on their head as a living crown.

lahu.name: Lahu
lahu.description: Lahu never stops doing its spinning dance even when predators are around.

booploo.name: Booploo
booploo.description: This flightless bat has been depicted in mythology as a satanic figure.

diadot.name: Diadot
diadot.description: Found drifting through space, its celestial diamond shell protects its organic dot interior.

dino.name: Dino
dino.description: They have more in common with kaiju than dinosaurs.

flatears.name: Flatears
flatears.description: Its wide, flat ears let it sense danger from miles away, making it nearly impossible to catch.

manifold.name: Manifold
manifold.description: Its body receives no shadows because Manifold’s skin has flipped normals.

garbon.name: Garbon
garbon.description: Miners occasionally mistake the cave dwelling Garbon’s gleaming shell for precious ore, a mistake they quickly regret.

hermit.name: Hermit
hermit.description: Hermits compete for the best shells. Those with the best homes are weary of attack from other Hermits.

hog.name: Hog
hog.description: In its sack-like body Hogs naturally secrete sugars over stored food preparing treats for after winter.

kiki.name: Kiki
kiki.description: It’s spikes are not actually sharp.

grassket.name: Grassket
grassket.description: Its body is made out of grass. Some have eaten Grasskets alive as salad.

brackey.name: Brackey
brackey.description: Brackey’s small size makes its long neck an evolutionary mystery.

magpole.name: Magpole
magpole.description: Some Magpole owners like to decorate their pet with fridge magnets.

manique.name: Manique
manique.description: A common pet for young girls who love brushing hair.

jego.name: Jego
jego.description: Our ancestors wore Jego as masks into war.

mount.name: Mount
mount.description: The centerpiece of any rock garden, Mount exudes an aura of calm and balance.

pippy.name: Pippy
pippy.description: Too shy to be a mascot, Pippy hides behind other Pico Pals, quietly dodging the spotlight.

nombug.name: Nombug
nombug.description: Nombug has exactly two teeth. One on top and one on bottom.

orbulus.name: Orbulus
orbulus.description: The orb Orbulus holds is a part of its body holding its most vital organs.

parasquirm.name: Parasquirm
parasquirm.description: In the wild, parasquirm will lose battles intentionally in order to be eaten. Then they can take control of their host from within.

pawn.name: Pawn
pawn.description: Can move forward two tiles on the first turn.

noot.name: Noot
noot.description: Underneath its blubbery layer of skin are enormously large thighs for its body size.

pincharp.name: Pincharp
pincharp.description: It’s large pinchers are Pincharp’s only option for chewing food.

doofdoof.name: Doofdoof
doofdoof.description: Most people say Doofdoof are abominations of nature. Others think they are cute.

whirlrath.name: Whirlrath
whirlrath.description: Despite hovering in the sky, Whirlrath’s body is a root and its propellers are leaves.

Psyboi.name: Psyboi
Psyboi.description: Dissection has yet to reveal any body part resembling a brain in appearance or function.

puffstar.name: Puffstar
puffstar.description: Puffstar feels pain every time it puffs its body and extends spikes out from under its skin.

rarac.name: Rarac
rarac.description: Raracs rattle their tails at night hoping to attract children with candy to steal from.

babish.name: Babish
babish.description: Humans are like Babish, so many layers to peel and nothing at the center.

rhibab.name: Rhibab
rhibab.description: Scientists like to flick Rhibab’s horn because of the funny sounds it makes.

grubble.name: Grubble
grubble.description: The rock-like exterior holds organic organs on the inside.

bubug.name: Bubug
bubug.description: This insect’s legs aren’t as strong as you might think from its only rock-like appearance.

buddle.name: Buddle
buddle.description: When buried alive the result is the growth of a rare fruit cherished as a delicacy.

labby.name: Labby
labby.description: Labby’s fur is edible. It looks and feels just like cotton candy but tastes rather bitter.

tao.name: Tao
tao.description: The inside of its crystalline shell is a miniature black hole generating dark energy.

snowmit.name: Snowmit
snowmit.description: As male Snowmits age their snow line recedes.

blumneedle.name: Blumneedle
blumneedle.description: Considered to be a weed by most, they are quickly exterminated from any garden.

stingus.name: Stingus
stingus.description: For recreation, Stingus have been witnessed stinging themselves to achieve an altered state of consciousness.

mari.name: Mari
mari.description: Coastal towns are known for their deep fired Mari.

nova.name: Nova
nova.description: An ice crystal in its core is its life force.

bayray.name: Bayray
bayray.description: Bayray’s stinger doesn’t hurt, it feels like a ghostly chill running down your spine.

tackie.name: Tackie
tackie.description: Its wings struggle to lift its heavy metal stinger, making it a clumsy flier.

snuggus.name: Snuggus
snuggus.description: A dangerous menace to campers who leave food out that wild monsters can smell.

mhango.name: Mhango
mhango.description: Though its lower body is nearly useless, Mhango’s arms can lift twice its own weight.

tubaloo.name: Tubaloo
tubaloo.description: The various holes on its body act as speakers for shrill sounds.

gigituk.name: Gigituk
gigituk.description: No one remembers why we celebrate the winter solstice by eating Gigituk.

tootle.name: Tootle
tootle.description: Although an aquatic Pico Pal, Tootles dog paddle instead of dive. Colonies of rock-like shells can be seen floating in bodies of water.

tweezap.name: Tweezap
tweezap.description: Tweezap’s pinchers are an electrical plug compatible with electronics in most regions.

twingap.name: Twingap
twingap.description: Twingap heads take turns sleeping and the waking head drags the other along.

unikorn.name: Unikorn
unikorn.description: With human-like sense of rhythm, Unikorns have a peculiar taste for heavy metal music.

updo.name: Updo
updo.description: What appears to be magma that shoots from its head is output from the intestines.

wan.name: Wan
wan.description: Wan feasts on the bones of its prey.

incher.name: Incher
incher.description: Do to the demand from fishermen, Inchers can be bread for easy money.
